headline.seo: Russia Protests Treatment of Russians Held in Texas
headline.main: Russia Protests Treatment of Russians Arrested in Texas

docs.snippet: Several Russians accused of illegally exporting microelectronics to Russia have been subjected to “psychological and moral pressure” to admit their guilt, the Russian Foreign Ministry said....
docs.abstract: Russian Foreign Ministry says that several Russians arrested in Texas and accused of illegally exporting microelectronics to Russian military and intelligence agencies have been subjected to 'psychological and moral pressure' to make admissions of guilt.
docs.lead_paragraph: Several Russians accused of illegally exporting microelectronics to Russia have been subjected to “psychological and moral pressure” to admit their guilt, the Russian Foreign Ministry said.

headline.print_headline: Angelenos Celebrate The Arrival Of a Shuttle
headline.seo: Space Shuttle Endeavour Rolls Through Los Angeles
headline.main: Space Shuttle Endeavour Rolls Through Los Angeles

docs.snippet: The spacecraft attracted a parade atmosphere as it drew crowds during its slow trip through city streets to its retirement at the California Science Center....
docs.abstract: Space shuttle Endeavour rolls out of the Los Angeles International Airport for what has been named Mission 26: its two-day crawl through urban streets to retirement at the California Science Center 12 miles away; slow progress attracts a parade atmosphere as thousands gather to watch its final journey.
docs.lead_paragraph: The spacecraft attracted a parade atmosphere as it drew crowds during its slow trip through city streets to its retirement at the California Science Center.

headline.print_headline: Fighting for Women in the ‘Dark Heaven’ of Gaza
headline.seo: Andalib Adwan Shehada, Bold Voice for Gaza Women
headline.main: Fighting for Women in the ‘Dark Heaven’ of Gaza

docs.snippet: In a male-dominated society, Andalib Adwan Shehada has challenged attitudes toward abuse, rape, honor killing and divorce....
docs.abstract: Saturday Profile of Andalib Adwan Shehada, Muslim woman who has spent her lifetime in the Gaza Strip, and has challenged attitudes toward abuse, rape, honor killing and divorce in a male-dominated society.
docs.lead_paragraph: In a male-dominated society, Andalib Adwan Shehada has challenged attitudes toward abuse, rape, honor killing and divorce.

headline.print_headline: F.T.C. Said To Prepare For Lawsuit Vs. Google
headline.seo: F.T.C. Staff Prepares Antitrust Case Against Google Over Search
headline.main: Drafting Antitrust Case, F.T.C. Raises Pressure on Google

docs.snippet: For investigators preparing a recommendation that the government sue, a main line of inquiry has been whether Google has manipulated its search results to favor its products....
docs.abstract: Federal Trade Commission is preparing to recommend that the federal government sue Google, raising the ante in its antitrust confrontation with the search giant; case centers around whether Google manipulates search results to favor its own products, making it harder for competitors and their products to appear prominently on results pages.

byline.contributor: Claire Cain Miller and Edward Wyatt contributed reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: For investigators preparing a recommendation that the government sue, a main line of inquiry has been whether Google has manipulated its search results to favor its products.

headline.print_headline: A Sibling for a Shiny Art Show in London
headline.seo: Frieze Art Fair in London Adds Masters Show
headline.main: A Sibling for a Shiny Art Show in London

docs.snippet: The Frieze art fair in London this year is joined by Frieze Masters, across Regent’s Park from the older show....
docs.abstract: Frieze art fair in London this year is joined by Frieze Masters, separate show across Regent’s Park that features artwork made before 2000; additional exhibit is clever expansion of Frieze's brand, designed to capitalize on the thousands of art world figures that arrive in London every October.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Frieze art fair in London this year is joined by Frieze Masters, across Regent’s Park from the older show.

headline.print_headline: Flashing Lights and Thrashing Music in a Search for Order and Chaos
headline.seo: ‘Political Mother,’ by Hofesh Shechter, at BAM
headline.main: Flashing Lights and Thrashing Music in a Search for Order and Chaos

docs.snippet: The first evening-length work by the choreographer Hofesh Shechter, “Political Mother” is loud, jittery and ambiguous....
docs.abstract: Brian Seibert reviews Hofesh Shechter's dance piece Political Mother, performed by the Hofesh Shechter Company at the Brooklyn Academy of Music.
docs.lead_paragraph: The first evening-length work by the choreographer Hofesh Shechter, “Political Mother” is loud, jittery and ambiguous.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Reports $1.1 Trillion Deficit in ’12, A Reduction
headline.seo: Federal Deficit for 2012 Fiscal Year Falls to $1.1 Trillion
headline.main: Federal Deficit for 2012 Falls to $1.1 Trillion

docs.snippet: The federal deficit fell to $1.1 trillion in the 2012 fiscal year, making it the smallest deficit since 2008, but representing the fourth year in a row that it has exceeded $1 trillion....
docs.abstract: Obama administration says federal deficit has fallen to $1.1 trillion in 2012 fiscal year, making it the smallest deficit since 2008, but representing the fourth year in a row that it has exceeded $1 trillion.
docs.lead_paragraph: The federal deficit fell to $1.1 trillion in the 2012 fiscal year, making it the smallest deficit since 2008, but representing the fourth year in a row that it has exceeded $1 trillion.

headline.print_headline: Taliban Reiterate Vow to Kill Pakistani Girl
headline.seo: Malala Yousafzai Faces New Taliban Threat
headline.main: Taliban Reiterate Vow to Kill Pakistani Girl

docs.snippet: The Pakistan police said they had made several arrests in the shooting of the teenage education activist Malala Yousafzai, but the Taliban said she would be targeted again....
docs.abstract: Pakistan police say they have made several arrests in the shooting of teenage activist Malala Yousafzai, but the Taliban reiterate their vow to kill her; fate of Yousafzai, who has become a symbol of defiance of the Taliban’s extremist ideology, has gripped Pakistan.

byline.contributor: Sana ul Haq contributed reporting from Mingora, Pakistan, and Ismail Khan from Peshawar, Pakistan.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Pakistan police said they had made several arrests in the shooting of the teenage education activist Malala Yousafzai, but the Taliban said she would be targeted again.
